head.supplied: ¶ I have the honor to report for the information of His Excellency the Lieutenant Governor, that the fourth white Swan presented some time since to the Botanic Gardens by W. Piper Esqre died on Thurs...

div.p: C53/12639, unit 185, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 856 Colonial Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 7.9.53. To proof.
On 17 December Foster remarked: '!!! a coroners inquest on a swan'; 'read very interesting'.
The Colonial Surgeon, W. McCrae, wrote to J. Balmain on 9 December 1853: 'I beg to inform you that the cause of the death of the Swan which you sent me for examination was disease of the Liver as ascertained by post mortem examination.' (C53/12639, unit 185, VPRS 1189).
I have the honor to report for the information of His Excellency the Lieutenant Governor, that the fourth white Swan presented some time since to the Botanic Gardens by W. Piper Esqre died on Thursday last the 8th Instant.

2Being aware that His Excellency had taken an interest in the preservation of these Birds, I have requested the Colonial Surgeon to ascertain the cause of death; and beg to enclose a copy of his reply.
